website_summaries.verdict: Slightly narrower dimensions and position-adjustable cup holders make this option ideal for larger families with limited backseat space.
pros: Adjustable cup holders rotate inward to save space
Roomy interior with plush padding and a supportive headrest
Adapts to a belt-positioning booster seat
Sturdy steel frame, but lightweight overall
cons: Harness release button can be difficult to reach

website_summaries.verdict: For a little more money, you are are getting a car seat that can go from rear facing infant to when your big kid has outgrown car seats.
pros: Can be a rear facing car seat
Transitions with your child to become a booster when needed
Include cup holders that rotate to make the seat slimmer when you need the space
Grows with your child, from 5 lbs
cons: While this seat is rated for infants, it is not designed to be removed from a car like other infant carrier type car seats – which is something you want when baby is sleeping

customer_reviews.title: Held up after totalling car
customer_reviews.text: My 3 children and I were in a car accident at 60mph. 2 year old was in this carseat and walked away from the accident with just biting his tongue. So thankful for the protection this seat provided him!
customer_reviews.author: Parent

customer_reviews.title: recommend this seat for small cars
customer_reviews.text: It's a tight fit! But we were able to fit 3 car seats across in my Ford Escape! We had the graco 4ever and graco nautilus before these and they were too wide to be able to have the infant seat next to them. We switched them out for 2 slimfits and now the infant seat fits perfectly! Def. recommend this seat for small cars!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The placement of safety sticker makes the car seat unusable in warmer months.
customer_reviews.text: The safety sticker hits in the middle of my daughters back and becomes too hot to touch when it is sitting in the car at 65 degrees. The sticker retains heat to an uncomfortable temperature for about 20 minutes after the car is started. The first time it was warm my daughter was screaming that her back was hot and I just thought she was throwing a fit until I touched the sticker. I do love everything else about this car seat.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Ruskin

customer_reviews.title: Will not use anything else....
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love ours. We have 2 side by side so that my teenager can sit by the other door. Everyone is comfortable. The sets are soft comfy for babies and easy to wash. I like that they are easy to change positions and when using rear facing it has storage for extra lock clasps so that there are not extra pieces loose. Best purchase by far.....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beware, your kids will sweat!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this product 1 star because the large warning label, that is not breathable at all, sits right up the spine of my kids. This label is conveniently not in the stock images.
customer_reviews.author: June Gold

customer_reviews.title: Terrible car seat
customer_reviews.text: I bought an 4 in 1 Graco car seat and it worked well. but this one, it's cheaply made. The latch is so short that can't tighten just like others siad. the Anchor strap is so short no joke, that it looks like a baby's belt. I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: sunkiss4444

customer_reviews.title: Best seat!  You will not be disappointed at all!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing car seat. If you are looking at this seat vs. the Graco Forever, save your cash and go with this seat. It's comfortable, a breeze to install, and it is slim fitting as described. It is also considerably cheaper than the Forever, and only minus a few seat settings and the backless booster (in reality, even buying a booster separately STILL saves you money). Using this side by side with a Forever, and I honestly can't believe I spent that much money when this seat does everything and more! For comparison, this is the same seat as the Graco Milestone (which we also own), but narrower and with collapsing cup holders.
customer_reviews.author: Kristie H.

customer_reviews.title: Great "slim" carseat at nice price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because of the "slim" design. It doesn't seem quite as slim as a Diono or Clek, but definitely not as wide as some other brands and models, and at a much more affordable price. I can fit this rear facing in the center, a Diono Ranier forward facing on one side, and a booster on the other in the center row of my Explorer xlt. I keep the cup holder folded in on the side with the Diono, but the other cup holder is usable. It seems very plush and comfy. DS fell asleep within 5 minutes of his first ride in it, too.
customer_reviews.author: Lil Mondu

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use, great safety ratings, very slender
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough good things about this carseat!! I have two kids and have tried several different carseats. I do a lot of research before buying. We originally bought a diono because of how slender it was and I hated it. Super hard to adjust the headrest and my son complained it was uncomfortable. The head rest, buckles, install, everything on this Graco is so easy. My son says it's super comfy as well. I also have a Graco 4ever and it's just as great as that without the bulk! I loved it so much I bought a second one for my other child! I would definitely reccomend this carseat to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Brittney

customer_reviews.title: Inconvenient
customer_reviews.text: I liked this car seat, until one of my children got sick in the seat. The pads were easily removed for washing but the straps would not come off. We had to hand wash the straps while on the seat still. We also have a graco 4-ever that comes completely apart, so maybe we have just been spoiled to that? Either way, I wish the straps to this seat were removable for easy washing.
customer_reviews.author: Misti Heffington

customer_reviews.title: Best car seat
customer_reviews.text: I wanted my daughter to sit on the middle seat but her old car seat was always kinda shakey there. So we bought this one and it just stays in place line it’s glued on! The installation was quick and easy. The seat itself is bigger than expected. I can’t really imagine fitting another one next to it into my corolla but who knows! I read some in reviews that it’s possible. I like how safe the seat seams to be and that it comes with cup holders! So helpful!
customer_reviews.author: Emmelie

customer_reviews.title: No leg room.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our 18 month old grand daughter, still in rear facing position... We don't like it. Her knees are in her chest. We have 3 different people try to install it so her legs fit.. No one can make it work. Keep looking. Don't buy this seat for a rear facing child.
customer_reviews.author: linyowe

customer_reviews.title: but good enough to fit two RF in the third row ...
customer_reviews.text: Not as slim as our beloved Diono car seats by a long shot, but good enough to fit two RF in the third row of our Pilot. If you need to fit three or more car seats in your vehicle, I recommend combining this with a Diono R100. I fit this and another bulky Graco in the third row of our Pilot on the left and right side, then our older two FF in Diono R100s in the driver side and center seats so we can access the third row with the folding seat. The narrower design is helpful, but doesn't put this anywhere near the league of Diono and Clek.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and poorly constructed
customer_reviews.text: I hated this car seat! It is flimsy and poorly constructed, so much so that pressure on the sides results in a cracking sound. The seams of the plastic parts aren't in good spots and they don't seem very securely connected. I had serious doubts that the car seat could survive regular wear and tear, much less go through a car crash so I returned for a better model (the Extend2Fit, which I have had before).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended. Fits sedan. Light and slim.
customer_reviews.text: We really like this seat. This is the second one we bought for our 17 month old. Fits behind the passenger seat of our Camry just fine. The passenger seat has to be move forward a couple clicks, but that is where my wife sits anyways. It fits in the middle of my extended truck just fine. In my truck we have to run the lap belt through the chair because it doesn’t have the click connect points. Works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Gpujic

customer_reviews.title: Seemingly comfortable with plenty of room to grow
customer_reviews.text: My daughter (20 months at the time of this purchase) seems to be comfortable in this carseat and fusses a lot less when we take trips. The legroom is really dependent on the size of your car/SUV/whatever, but there is plenty of space for our little one to grow with this seat. The safety ratings were great for this seat and I trust this brand. The seat is also easy to install/remove for those that need to remove the seat from time to time for whatever reason. I find I can install it in less that 5 minutes--of course, removal takes even less time.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Plagens

customer_reviews.title: Awesome...only as a forward facing seat.
customer_reviews.text: Great car seat for forward facing only...yep. Rear facing this seat is a nightmare. The idiots who designed this car seat made sure there was a HUGE gap between the base of this seat and the back of the vehicles seat, so...no matter what you do you will never get a safe install rear facing because you can get this thing as tight as humanly possible and it will ALWAYS fold into the back seat with just a tiny nudge, face planting your child into the back seat (which I suppose they thought was safer than the car seat not moving at all?)
customer_reviews.author: Beansssss

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and much more comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This car seat was super easy to install, easier than the infant car seat in my opinion. For the latch system you click it into the latch and can push a release button to release so super easy if you are going in between two cars. Which we will be. The padding and head supports are nice for when your baby falls asleep in the car. We love this car seat!!!! And a lot slimmer than the Graco 4 ever, that is the main reason I didn't pick the graco 4ever was the bulkiness.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Boulden

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this due to my 6 month old crying in his Graco infant car seat, even just to the store. My baby boy is only 16lbs and 25in, but was clearly uncomfortable in his infant carrier. This slim fit car seat is amazingly comfortable for my baby boy, no more long crying fits just to the grocery store. I have it in a 2014 Ford Focus sedan. It fits more comfortably in the middle rear seat. I tried the passenger side and noticed it fits tightly against the seat if an average sized person is sitting in the front seat. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Mechanic Dude

customer_reviews.title: Better than Contender 65
customer_reviews.text: Had the Graco Contender 65 car seat and could NOT get it to cinch down tight enough. This was a problem with many of the reviews. Returned it and purchased the Graco Slim-fit. I was able to get it secure enough. Seems to have the safety features, but am able to secure it. It also has a different latch handle that makes it much easier to secure to the vehicle latch hooks. Like this model much better. A winner!
customer_reviews.author: D Mart

customer_reviews.title: Safe and Secure
customer_reviews.text: We have very happy with this car seat. It is slimmer like it says, but not by too much. Lots of padding, especially around baby’s head. Good cushioned seat and very adjustable. I wouldn’t say it was the easiest to install, but that wasn’t really a concern. It’s safe, it’s comfortable and we’re not taking it in and out, so it works well for us. Has a handy hiding place for the manual to keep it with the seat. Dual cup holders is a nice touch too that we didn’t think we needed, but has been useful. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: E Ritz

customer_reviews.title: Missing Pieces - no response from support request
customer_reviews.text: Seems OK but I'm missing one of the the harness covers. I requested support from their website over a week ago. (and yes I checked my spam filters). Seems silly to return it over a small piece of padding, but if Graco can't support their products, what can one do?
customer_reviews.author: Alan S.

customer_reviews.title: Great car seat, Difficult to figure out.
customer_reviews.text: Evidentally we did not realize that the seat does not snap out of the base as did our old one. Consequently we spent an inordinate time trying to figure it out. It is also longer and makes it necessary to have front passenger keep their seat closer to the front having less leg room. Well constructed and our grandbabies seemed content in it. Like the fact that it continues to adjust as child grows older.
customer_reviews.author: Ola Mullet

customer_reviews.title: Great car seat
customer_reviews.text: This car seat seat has been very good so far. We have one and our daughter has two of them. The buckles, straps etc. work well and the kids seem comfortable in them. This was a replacement for another brand where the strap you pulled to tighten up the shoulder straps would get hung up and the MFG was useless to do anything about the problem (two seats had the same problem). All I can say is we would purchase these again.
customer_reviews.author: WoodWiz

customer_reviews.title: Comfy rear or forward facing; fits Nissan Rogue
customer_reviews.text: This was our second of the exact car seat. We use Graco Slim Fit 3 in 1 for both children. Our older child is forward facing (3.5 years) and our younger is rear facing (13 months). The straps tighten with ease, the padding for neck/shoulders are comfortable for long rides, installation is easy, and the height adjustment is painless. Two cupholders fold in, saving more room if needed. Fits well in Nissan Rogue.
customer_reviews.author: KD

customer_reviews.title: Good seat.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install. I bought it for friends coming over with kid for a week. I've never installed child seat, but was able to figure out how to install and adjust it in around 20 minutes. I believe instructions could have been more clear on certain things, images were confusing too, maybe they should add some actual images to it. No issues with comfort of the seat. Fit in middle of back seat, not whole a lot of room for passengers, but enough for smaller people to be comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Roman

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend for newborns
customer_reviews.text: Would not recommend for newborns or younger babies without head control yet. The furthest recline position is not back enough for a young baby to recline. I like this for my 10 month old. Her head slumps forward though. I like all the cushion and options. I personally like the latch install best to get it snug. I did have to use a rolled up towel between the carseat and backseat for it to be snug. Hope this lasts for years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and safe
customer_reviews.text: The seat is comfortable as my son who always cries when you put him on the other car seat did not cry on this one. Based on the information the seat is sturdy and safe yet light weight compared to other car seats in this category. The only con I see was that when I tried to install the car seat with the latch attachment the seat was not so tight and I am not able to tighten the strap to make it fit. Overall i am happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: JKM

customer_reviews.title: Used to love it.
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install. Easy to tighten. Seems comfortable. UPDATE: I love this car seat. However my son threw up in the car seat all over the harness straps. They CANNOT be taken out and CANNOT be replaced. And you are not supposed to submerge them in water or use cleaner on them. So now I am stuck with a car seat that smells heavily of vomit and no way to clean it. 😭😭
customer_reviews.author: A. Noon

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Really great quality car seat. It was easy to install, took less than 5 minutes for it to feel very secure. I did watch a youtube video and read the directions prior to installation. I used the latch system. The seat itself is very comfortable. Straight out of the box, toddler ran over and sat in it. Love that it's easy to tilt, belts easy to move around/adjust, and easy click and unclick for an adult. Really cool idea about the cup holders giving extra space if needed. Love everything about this seat. Would definitely recommend for others.
customer_reviews.author: JTanner

customer_reviews.title: Versatile
customer_reviews.text: We just received this seat for my 4 month old. It is extremely user friendly and versatile. It fits my average sized 6 year old, 4 year old, and 4 month old when adjusted to their heights. I’m optimistic it will be a long lasting seat for us. We chose this seat for a three across seating arrangement in a Honda Pilot. It is installed next to a Harmony Defender and Diono Radian RXT and fits properly. We will also try it in a Honda Accord three across with two Harmony Defenders. Having it in person, it appears it will work, but we still need to test it.
customer_reviews.author: CRF

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: I love this car seat! I got it for my rather large 10 month old daughter and it's perfect. I have a smaller car and was looking for something that was more compact while still being very safe and able to grow with the child and this car seat hits the nail on the head. It also only took me 2 seconds to install it into my car. I have a Graco extend2fit convertible car seat for my 2 year old and I love that car seat, but the slim fit is even better in my opinion! Couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Caylee

customer_reviews.title: Great car seat for Kia Soul!
customer_reviews.text: I searched for the perfect car seat for our Kia Soul and our precious grandchildren and this one is perfect! A great fit in my little car and believe it or not, the adjusting cup holders are great. You can move them out of the way for the other seat to fold or just to get them out of the way when putting the kids in the seat. Very pleased. I had not installed a car seat in 33 years so it was a challenge at first but once you find all the hidden parts, it's so easy! Would definitely recommend this brand and this particular seat for small cars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The latch that strap down the head area is a huge pain to tighten
customer_reviews.text: So if you compare this car seat to the track contender, it’s a lot more compact but it does have more room around my son. The recline options are really good because my son doesn’t want to be at a angle anymore and wants to sit upright so even though he’s rear facing, his car seat isn’t extending the head area, to the the center console. It seems like he has more room around his arms and legs and is much more comfortable. This car seat also has new born inserts so I high recommend this car seat over the others. Even the deluxe. It really does help people with smaller SUVs
customer_reviews.author: Jacquelyn enriquez

customer_reviews.title: Easy to remove...
customer_reviews.text: I'll start off by saying the car seat isn't really that much slimmer than other car seats. So don't expect too much of a difference. However the seat is really easy to install and a heckuva lot easier to remove than all the other car seats I've owned. The anchors have buttons that you simply press and it releases. My daughter still uses the first backward facing setting but it appears fairly cozy. Love the fact that she won't need another seat for a long time, if ever. For the price, this has to be one of the best deals out there.
customer_reviews.author: Cesar G.

customer_reviews.title: Great adjustability
customer_reviews.text: I really like the adjustability of the car seat. I tried another that didn't have the ability to adjust as much as this Graco Slim Fit and had to return it. The other car seat (facing backwards) leaned too far back and would not allow the front passenger seat to move back to a comfortable position (we are tall people). This seat is comfortable for baby and front passenger. I gave it a 4 star rating because the straps can be hard to tighten if they are not evenly distributed.
customer_reviews.author: colleen b

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: Very good value. I bought 2 and happy with the purchase. Only conplaint is taking off the covers to clean is a little more of a pain than you would hope and the cross strap to secure to the hooks do not work very well. Extremely difficult to pull tight enough so that the car seat does not move more than an inch side to side. It is the lock mechanism on the strap that is poorly designed. Everything else is great rhough. Just be prepared to spend an hour just trying to get the seat tight enough where it actually feels secure.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Super Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my infinity
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace the bucket baby seat for my 1 year old granddaughter. I needed something that was not too bulky as I have an infinity and did not want to lose my entire back seat. My husband installed in under 15 minutes, after watching a u tube video. The seat is very functional, as the back can be raised and the seat angle changes as well. There are two cup holders that turn in if you are not using. The seat itself is very sturdy and attractive. The buttons on the 5 point harness are comfortable for my arthritic fingers! My son liked this seat so much he purchased 2 for his cars! Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: cindy

customer_reviews.title: Great car seat!
customer_reviews.text: I was reading reviews & looking for prices. This was the car seat with the best price and the most great reviews so I purchased it for my almost 2 year old. I LOVE it. It fits in my 4 door Jeep Wrangler which already has another car seat. It saves SO much space, and there’s still room to recline both of the front seats. I love that it’s modern, the cup holders, the color. My daughter looks comfty in it, and she still has room for her legs even though she’s still rear facing. SO easy to install! Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: aaron rey

customer_reviews.title: Held my son in like bubble wrap!
customer_reviews.text: I had my 2 year old in this seat during a wreck 2 days ago. Someone turned and hit us off guard. He was completely injury free with just a sore neck. Thanking God we spent the time researching this seat!! We could not recommend it more!
customer_reviews.author: Brogan Hicks

customer_reviews.title: Able to fit 3 car seats across
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these since we have a 3rd child on the way, and don't have a 3rd row vehicle (chevy impala 2011). We have a 3 year old that forward faces, a 1 year old that just outgrew his baby carrier, and needed a newborn carrier to fit as well. After many weeks of research, we bought these and was pleasantly surprised how light they were to pick up to out in the car. I used the lap latches for both and they were quick and easy to install. There is plenty of leg room for both kids and the baby carrier doesn't push against them. Once the baby outgrows the infant seat, I'll plan on buying a 3rd!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Great car seat
customer_reviews.text: I initially thought the cup holders were missing, they spin around after being slightly lifted 🤦 Overall absolutely LOVE this seat. Wish we would've bought this instead of the Forever seat because it's not as large. Both excellent choices though!
customer_reviews.author: Outdoorsymom

customer_reviews.title: Consider this vs 4 in 1 Graco product
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th Graco product. I originally bought the 4 in 1 convertible seat for my car and my husband (1st child). I wish I would have purchased this originally. It is a nice product with similar quality to the much more expensive seat. By the time I will be using my 4 in 1 as a booster, it will be so used looking (and dirty) from years of toddler/child use. This seat is slimmer and I love the cupholder style of this seat. Plush seat and easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Suz

customer_reviews.title: Love graco
customer_reviews.text: I bought This as a amazon warehouse purchase which I love when it’s available I have never got a bad product from the warehouse the box was damaged ow well I didn’t need it any ways and we r putting our 8 month old grandson in it and he has never really like the infant seats but loves this on I purchased a graco for my grand daughter about 2 years ago in the same model because this model is so easy to install as well as adjusting the straps for growing babies is so easy too
customer_reviews.author: lisa

customer_reviews.title: Best Graco Purchase I’ve ever made
customer_reviews.text: This is probably one of my favorite purchases from Grace. I have used a lot of their products over the last 10 years. This is by far my favorite. My son finally outgrew his original car seat and I had been searching for weeks for a suitable replacement and found this. The cup holders invert to save room. The seat itself has a ton of safety features and special stuff to help the seat grow with your child. It’s also super easy to install and figure out. A lot of the stuff, the the strap cushions, are removable if it’s not something your comfortable with. I love this seat, and so does my son!
customer_reviews.author: Cally Baker

customer_reviews.title: Second car seat
customer_reviews.text: Bought this seat for our 1year old. Still have to keep it rear facing until 2. We have a truck and saloon car and there is not enough leg room for even the smallest adult on either passenger seats.After it will face forward there will be a plenty of room in both vehicles. I can’t imagine how much bigger is the regular seat while this one is a slim fit. That being said, we are very happy with this seat. It’s super comfy for our kid, looks well build and it was super easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It fits in a 2013 Ford Escape
customer_reviews.text: We drive a 2013 Ford Escape. Having enough space was a concern for us because we have a 13 month old and I'm due any day now with our second. We bought this for our 13 month old and installed it on the passenger side and it fits perfectly rear facing. We did not have to scoot the seat up at all! It also fits perfectly next to the chico 360 car seat that our second will be taking over which is installed in the middle. We do have it installed on the 2nd recliner position for rear facing but there is still room if we needed to put it on the first.
customer_reviews.author: MegMos18

customer_reviews.title: Not really compact?
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and easy install BUT its not really compact? I bought it for our Jetta because our $90 from sams club leaves the passenger seat pushed up pretty far (rear facing position). The base is skinnier but the top is even wider than normal seat. In my ridgeline this seat wont fit in the back middle seat between the front seats. The top is just to wide. The seat is nice but is it worth $100 more than our other two... no... definitely not.
customer_reviews.author: Tom4rmMarketing

customer_reviews.title: Durable, compact, comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with theses car seats. I was looking for a compact, yet durable and comfortable seat for my small car and theses meet my expectations. It was a bit confusing moving the straps to forward facing. You have to removed the pads and slide the seat latch belt up to the other side. My 2yo twins seem to really enjoy them and their fussiness decreased some while being in theses seats. During the first ride they fell asleep after about 10min down the road.
customer_reviews.author: jedijay

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Its Pretty and comfortable for my two year old. She loves it. We use it forward facing because rear facing I feel like her legs were bending in her old infant chair and this one is really no different rear facing so i just wanted her to be comfortable and stretch her legs and she’s already old enough to sit forward facing. She feels like a big girl in this chair and can sit the way her siblings do. She said “i like it my new chair “ :) Was easy to install. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Z Mezrahi

customer_reviews.title: Best carseat I've ever bought.
customer_reviews.text: this carseat is beautiful and so very easy to install! It took me so much less time than others I've had. My son is 3, 35lbs and 37 inches tall and he fits in it perfectly. I got the narrower one since I have a smaller vehicle but for my son being big he fits just fine. I love that you don't have to re-thread the shoulder straps. My son still falls asleep often in the car and his head does flop forward which makes me nervous but that is my only complaint with this seat! It is worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Nichole P.

customer_reviews.title: Im on hold
customer_reviews.text: I think the product is a good product but the latch strap which holds the car seat to the car is too short and won't reach, even with full extension. I drive a Tesla. I called customer support but 40 minutes later have not gotten through and I am still on hold. There is no excuse for poor customer support. I initially rated it a 1 but upgraded to a 4 due to getting through to customer service and resolving the problem. The customer service was great when I finally got through, and the product is great but reaching customer service after waiting over 45 minutes is still not reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: rchin99

customer_reviews.title: Not so slim
customer_reviews.text: I bought it because it said "slim" maybe it's slimer than others but it's huge in my car and allows no leg room facing backward. It fits snug leaning on the back of the driver seat. Easy to install if you have latch system otherwise it's almost impossible to thread the belt through it. it's nice quality and looks tho.
customer_reviews.author: Moe

customer_reviews.title: My favorite carseat
customer_reviews.text: We have the Grace 4ever and Milestone carseats, but when I bought my new Kia, I wanted to get one for both my kiddos allowing room for if we had a 3rd. This carseat is just as great as our 4ever and Milestones. My kids both love this seat (one rear and one forward facing). They're super comfortable, and the double cupholders that can be pushed in or out are fantastic. My daughter has no trouble putting her cup or snacks in it and grabbing them out. They're sturdy and very easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah E. McCauley

customer_reviews.title: Great carseat, but not in love with the leg straps...
customer_reviews.text: We purchased both this carseat and the 4Ever 4-in-1 carseat. I prefer this carseat over the 4-in-1. It has a slimmer profile, making it easier to fit in the middle seat next to the carseat. I also much prefer the shoulder straps on this. My only concern is that the leg straps fit over my 1-year-old son's legs, not his hips. I have researched and this is safe and normal, but I don't like the fit.
customer_reviews.author: Bianca

customer_reviews.title: Glad I found this
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a second car seat because the extend to fit version is too bulky for a compact SUV and this works because I was able to place two carseat side by side and there is enough space for 1 person at the back. This is well made and a lot cheaper than other convertible car seat.
customer_reviews.author: only for good stuff

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Car seat for rear and forward facing toddler’s
customer_reviews.text: I bought this car seat for my car to use with my grandsons. This was recommended to me by my daughter who is already using the same car seat. She is a big safety advocate and really researched out car seats. We like this one because it is slimmer than the other bulky car seats we have purchased. I really love the look and the streamline of the seat. It will be used for my three-year-old rear facing and my front facing five-year-old grandson.
customer_reviews.author: yolie

customer_reviews.title: Nice Buckles
customer_reviews.text: The button to loosen the straps is really smooth and easy to operate. The cup holders are a nice feature. The profile is low enough to get the baby in and out fairly easily. The height adjuster is user friendly. The leg room is lacking, even for my short statured toddler, but it doesn't seem to bother her yet.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Lynn Engelhardt

customer_reviews.title: Best. Carseat. Ever
customer_reviews.text: I cannot say enough about this carseat. Easiest install I've ever seen. Super sturdy. Easily adjustable, AND easily cleaned (you'd never know my son threw up an insane amount on a road trip after too many sweets snuck by well meaning relatives). We loved it so much in my husband's truck (Toyota Tundra) we got the same for my Jeep Liberty and will be buying another for Grandma's car. I love that it will last through every stage!
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great car seat bought for our daughter when she turned one because she is smaller in the weight side we needed something that would allow her to be rear facing longer and not take up too much room in my car. She loves it and so do we! It was easy to install and once we got a hang of where our clips were it’s easy to switch to another car if needed. Will definitely buy another one for our neswest addition when she arrives
customer_reviews.author: rebecca chavez

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: Love this car seat! It’s easy to install and more importantly, easy to get a kiddo in and out of. And the size is reasonable. I first bought a larger 4 in 1 graco and it was HUGE! Like absurd huge. I drive and SUV and it consumed my back seat. I think I will always stick with the slim. Bought one for my suv and one for my husbands truck! And the two cup holders is a two thumbs up, 10 finger high five For reference I have a tall 14 month old. We started using the slim when he was 10 months old and he LOVES it compared to his infant car seat
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great seat for Subaru Forester!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely happy with all aspects of this seat. It fits great in my Subaru Forester behind the passenger side. My son loves it too. Cup holders are closer to him than in our Chicco. Easy to take apart and clean in the washing machine after spills, and easy to vacuum. The release lever is also very smooth.
customer_reviews.author: EV

customer_reviews.title: Best toddler seat ever.
customer_reviews.text: This car seat is everything I was hoping for. I drive a 2016 Honda Civic, my back seat isn’t tiny but still not huge. My little guy has plenty of leg room while rear facing and will have plenty more when he is front facing. The padding in the seat is so comfy for him and the cup holders are a great add for him. The seat itself was very simple to install, and it’s easy to take out if I need to. The was much easier to get in than the infant base from the infant seat. I’m a loyal Graco customer and this seat is part of why.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Stubbs

customer_reviews.title: fit 3 across back seat in Charger
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install, cushy and can fit 3 across in back seat of Charger. Wanted car seats with cup holders that can go 3 across in back seat. I kept getting different sizes from people so I just ordered 2 for twins for rear facing and already had the larger graco 4 in 1 dlx front facing. Only able to use one cup holder on slim fit each but that's all we need for now. The three fit fine across back. Love these!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't ask for more!
customer_reviews.text: I initially bought the Evenflo Symphony and it arrived with the head rest snapped off. That made me a little nervous so I did more research and decided to switch brands. I knew I wanted to go with Graco but was debating between the 4Ever, Milestone, and Slim Fit. For the price difference and not many more perks, I couldn't justify buying the 4Ever. I went with the Slim Fit because it has 2 cupholders where the Milestone has only 1. So far I am really happy with the product. My boys seem comfortable and content riding in the seats and I feel confident that they are safe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I love how easy it is to adjust with growing kids. It works great for my toddler! No longer do i find diaper patter prints on her butt after rising in the car for an hour. It is more slim than a standard car steat. The only reason i gave 4 stars is because the level ball isnt on both sides. So i can check it while in the car, i have to get out and check. That isn't even a big deal since you install it from the outside the car. I also really wish i could take it out and snap it in a stroller. Other then that, i love it!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use comfortable and safe!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had gotten this for my older daughter too! It’s not a whole lot slimmer than the regular grace forever but the cup holders fold in to streamline it (making the middle seat in my car useable) and the straps are better in my opinion-they don’t get as tangled. The red button style latch hooks are 1,000% better than the more user friendly than the older style that i would fight with to get on and off.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Great Car Seat
customer_reviews.text: I have the 4-Ever Graco car seat for my 4-year old granddaughter, but needed another car seat for my 1-year old granddaughter. I wanted to save room because the Graco SlimFit would be behind the driver's seat. I love Graco products, and this car seat will not disappoint the pickiest of buyers. It definitely saves room while providing adequate leg room for the child. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect car seat
customer_reviews.text: We bought one when pur grand daughter was born for our daughter to use. That is being used in her mother-in-law's car. Our son-in-law bought one for his car, then our daughter got one for hers. This is the 4th one purchased for one little girl. We like the slim fit, gives other passengers more room. Easy to install and remove. I love the way the harness adjusts with the back of the carseat. Great little carseat.
customer_reviews.author: A OLSEN

customer_reviews.title: Just the best!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this car seat so much. I had a love-hate relationship with car seats up until this one (love that they protect my kid but hate everything else about them). The slim design fits well in my vehicle. It’s easy to install. The straps loosen and tighten so easily! And the push button used to adjust the shoulder strap height without having to rethread is a GAME CHANGER! I haven’t found anything about it I don’t like. Though I haven’t had to wash it yet... but still, I’m planning to eventually replace all of my car seats with this one. Skipping the infant carrier kind and going straight to a convertible like this one for any future babies!
customer_reviews.author: Richard L. Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Great compact car seat for small cars
customer_reviews.text: All the things I love about my Bigger Graco in a more compact seat. My husband recently got a Kia Rio and trying to get my big graco 4-in-1 and our second Safety 1st seat into that smaller backseat was tough. My graco fit the best, but took up so much room so we ordered this one. I got this set up and secured in record time and it fits great. I did use the forward facing 5 point harness setting for this.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny B

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Very similar to the 4ever by graco but cup holders being able to move make it slimmer. And it is MUCH lighter. We have the 4ever for our daughter but at a cheaper price point (and the good things listed above) and just as good quality and good comfort (we had our four year old test it out and she said it felt just like her 4ever) we bought this for our son. Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Annie Mac

customer_reviews.title: Small yet mighty!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this at target last minute on a trip to Disney. We had a 4ever since she was 9 months and had plenty of life left but had a throw up incident. Usually I would clean it and wash but I decided I couldn’t do the trip with the throw up smell the whole time. Luckily they had this option left and I’m so glad! The slim fit is indeed slimmer, but doesn’t lack the safety features. So happy with it that I decided to upgrade the seat in my other car. def recommend! I have a 08 crv and 16 pilot. Leaves plenty of space!
customer_reviews.author: MilaJen

customer_reviews.title: Fits Nice in Center of Traverse!
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this and a 4ever. We kept this one because the baby seemed more comfortable and the fabric was nice! We sold the new 4ever. They are super similar. We didn't need the extra recline RF positions in the center of our Traverse. Leg room wasn't noticeably different in either. Fits nice. It almost butts up to the front seats and isn't super small at all. We will probably order a Milestone for a second vehicle when it's on a good sale.
customer_reviews.author: Erin B. Juntunen

customer_reviews.title: Great seat for a tight fit!
customer_reviews.text: I drive a 2015 Ford F-150 extended cab. So my backseat is a tight fit. I recently had a baby in May and bought this seat for my daughter to try to make some room. My 3 year old is still in his Graco extend to fit, and I really wish I would have bought one of these for him too. There’s a lot of padding on the butt and back which is what I like about it. It’s very easy to install. I’ll be buying one for my newest one when he gets a little bigger. It’s a great seat!
customer_reviews.author: Gena Mullins

customer_reviews.title: WorksGreat, great price
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted a simple not bulky car seat. It was easy to install, the straps tighten easy, it doesn’t take up as much room as either of my other 2 (Recaro and Maxi Cosi). Only thing I think could be better (big I wouldn’t expect at this price) is more cushion and the clips that hold the straps out of the way. I was also happy the recline went far enough back I didn’t have to use a rolled towel or pool noodle to achieve the rear facing recline. Not difficult to get 18 month old in and out and he seems comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: JessVA

customer_reviews.title: Fits well in 2018 Kia Soul
customer_reviews.text: The slim fit fits perfectly in our back seat along with a Britax bsafe car seat and a small booster seat! We have a small Kia Soul 2018 so I’m very shocked that all 3 can fit. My oldest in the booster seat can still find his seat belt buckle even though the fit is snug. Highly recommend the slim fit for small cars. The slim fit has two swivel cup holders which gives more room when closed off. It also looks comfy and my 2 year old fits it perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Jovan Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Good car seat
customer_reviews.text: This car seat is good. My only complaint is that there are two big red plastic pieces (near my child’s ears) that don’t have any cloth or cushion covering over them. It doesn’t seem to bother my son, but it is somewhat bothersome to me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second time purchasing this item. I loved it the first time and had to replace it due to an accident. I can say this small but mighty safe in accident. I will be buying another when we need it!!!!! Oh and the slimmer design allows for three to fit in backseat with ease!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Graco SlimFit 3 in 1 Convertible Car Seat | Infant to Toddler Car Seat is a great product!
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly easy to install. We're using it as a rear-facing seat. The documentation was a great help. In a small car (2008 Civic 4-door) it's a little difficult to get my son in, but he's a big kid. By the time we flip the seat around, I hope to be in a different vehicle. The seat is heavier than I anticipated, but I consider this to be good. My son appears to be comfortable from the first ride.
customer_reviews.author: Sokayitsme

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we needed
customer_reviews.text: Best than expected!! I bought it because my baby hated the one he has before and I hoped this one will make him feel comfortable, and oh wao! He loved it!!! No more crying, and he likes the padded things, he goes all the ride touching everything like it wasn't real! I cannot say much about space because I have a Tucson 2016 and it fits like the other one we had. Between this one and my daughter's booster seat you have a small space for a person to be seated not for a long trip. The best thing is how easy to install it is and it feels very secure and safe.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Good for "slim" spaces
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a couple of years for a nice, smaller seat. This works wonders. I have a 2018 Jeep Compass, it has 60/40 rear fold down seats. The car seat is on the 40 portion and the other side can fold down with no issue and doesn't bump against it. My 5yo boy fits in perfect. The leg room is pretty good as well (with the passenger seat pulled up far). Plus, the LATCH system is xtra easy to install. I would highly recommend this seat for smaller vehicles.
customer_reviews.author: Diane B

customer_reviews.title: 1 and 3 year old love them!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for our 1 year old and 3 year old. Both are at very different stages but the car seat can handle them now and when they grow! One thing I did notice was this was a “slim fit” but my other car seat fit was more slim so actually had to move my seat even more forward than I thought. Our 3 year old says how comfortable the seats are and loves the cup holders. Would purchase again
customer_reviews.author: Paige Rubicon

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, Safe, and slim!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter really seems to enjoy this seat, she has never seemed to be fussy or uncomfortable in it and it is very easy to adjust as she grows. As well in a medium-sized vehicle, the slim width along with the collapsing cup holders are great. Without these features, the 60/40 bench seat in my jeep would not fold down to allow me to still put large items in the vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin S

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: This car seat is great! It was a game changer for our child who is already 20lb at 5mo old. He loves riding in the car so much more now that he is comfortable and has more room. This is so easy to install. Adjustments are way easy too. I had to wash the seat part (he has blow outs like it's his job) and it took me a few seconds to take it off while holding him in the other hand. I definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great seat!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great seat! Bought this one following another Graco 4Ever seat that my daughter was complaining about not being comfy. She loves it so much more that I bought two of these. More more room in the car and much easier to put her in it since the height is lower and so are the leg side bolsters. Only issue if I had to be picky is the pull tether for the side belts is a little difficult to pull and get the seat fully secured. Just more effort is needed and it's good. So I now own two of these and one 4Ever.
customer_reviews.author: Special-K

customer_reviews.title: Big, not that slim. Rear facing is awkward
customer_reviews.text: Bigger than I thought it would be. Not such a slim fit after all and is a bit awkward in any other seat then the middle. In the side seats it really doesn't fit as rear facing well in a Nissan rogue. The front seat it sits behind has to be pulled basically all the way forward leaving no room for a passenger to sit in that seat. Definitely can't put it behind the driver's seat. Couldn't get in to drive.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin M.

customer_reviews.title: Slim, Safe and Cozy
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this car seat. I had bought my infant a click connect and so this was an easy transition. At 6 mo fit snuggly and I felt she was even more secure than in her infant seat. We were able to fit me and my and my sister (full grown adults) in the backseat of a mid-size SUV With this seat. It was a tight fit but her seat took up no more room than an adult would have. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Simple
customer_reviews.text: So I did some research before ordering this particular car seat. This had the best ratings in my price range. I have a smaller SUV so this is perfect to save on room plus you can't beat a growing carseat . My 1 year old son hate his old infant car seat and would scream Everytime he was sitting in it. With the slim fit he is sitting higher and the seat is comfy. And to adjust the harness so is easy. I definitely recommend this car seat . I also think is can be used till 100 lbs/10 years old.
customer_reviews.author: Tee

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: My first daughter had the 4ever version and it worked okay for road trips but now with two I wanted something small but just as versatile. This is very similar but for some reason I think it is much better. It is more comfortable for my other daughter. The cup holders flip in which is a really nice feature. It is as skinny as my Dionos I have in my other car. Easy to install. Worth it for the price tag!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy install!
customer_reviews.text: I got this product for my parents so they would have a car seat for their granddaughter. Very easy and quick installation. My daughter is very comfortable in it and has plenty of room. The cup holders are a nice and convenient feature. I love the head rest/support. She naps in this seat better than the one we have in my car! May have to get another one and replace my old one.
customer_reviews.author: Bev

customer_reviews.title: Worth it! Love it! Bought two.
customer_reviews.text: This car seat has been amazing. Had it a little over a year. Loved it so much in the beginning we got the same one for my husbands car. It’s so easy to adjust the straps, head rest height, and seat belts. The liner comes out and can be put in the washer. It leans back or sits up. My daughter is still rear facing so we haven’t tried the forward facing yet. I also love the cup holders! They fold in, but we leave them out and put toys or snacks in. Or sippy cup. I recommend this car seat to everyone. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: We love this car seat! We had originally bought one. We loved it so much, we bought a second for the other car. Because our daughter is backwards facing, she gets car sick on long rides. She threw up a few times and after watching a YouTube video how to take the coverings off, it was much easier to clean. We can now take it apart and put back together with our eyes closed. She’s comfortable in it and it fits well in the 2016 Sante Fe and a 2017 Rouge.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Piegzik

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, durable, easy install, plenty of leg room
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd Graco Slimfit seat that I have bought. Each of my children use one and have zero complaints! Fairly compact side to side and front to back. I have a toyota 4runner and have one of these on each side in the 2nd row. I can still sit in between the 2 seats fairly comfortably if needed. I love that I am able to use this rear facing, forward facing, and also as a high back booster. Definitely recommend this seat!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Britax is much better
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so we wouldn't have to keep switching our other car seat (a Britax Boulevard) to another vehicle and then back. To save money, this Graco car seat seemed like a good option. Nope. It is bare bones, cheap quality, and I regret not just spending more to get another trusted Britax. Also, there is nothing slim about this. It weighs less than the Boulevard, but it takes up the same amount of space.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Best Carseat I've Ever Used.
customer_reviews.text: Easiest install ever! Easy adjusting to height! Only downside is release button hard to get to and a little hard to pull strap while rear facing (but that's all carseats in my experience for some reason) soft and comfy material.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Hard to tighten straps that secure child
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install using car’s latch system. However, once baby is in seat, we found it very hard to pull strap to tighten, almost seemed like strap was hung up somewhere. Maybe all brands’ car seats are like this? We ordered one for each car, and one pulled easier than the other. We ordered a third to replace the hard to pull seat, but the replacement was difficult too. Called Graco customer service who was wonderful and after troubleshooting, they offered to replace or refund, whichever we preferred.
customer_reviews.author: D.S

customer_reviews.title: Works in my small car
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use in my Honda Civic 2000, which I use to run around town and haul the grandkids in sometimes. My car is small, and this version fits just fine facing forward or backwards. This older car does not have the "latch" system, but does have top tethers and good seat belts. My main concern was getting something too big for the car. It works! The only reason for the 4 stars in "durability" and "easy to clean" is because I just don't know yet. Still too new to know.
customer_reviews.author: RobiM

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: After having the convenience of the Chicco Keyfit 30 I was looking for something that would last, be comfortable and easy to install. This seat has definitely met all of those points. I love that as your child grows you are able to adjust without having to take the whole seat apart. We also have a small car (Nissan Versa) and it allows for the other two seats in the back to be filled by adults without a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Marisabel Herrera

customer_reviews.title: Fit 3 across in jeep with a slimfit
customer_reviews.text: The graco slimfit fit perfectly in my backseat along with 2 graco tranzitions. I love that both styles of car seats have optional cupholders because it really helps squeeze out a couple more precious inches. Graco has AWESOME features like easy adjustable recline and the non rethread adjustable harness. The slim fit is exactly what we needed! Affordable. Quality. Easy.
customer_reviews.author: Sofia

product_meta.title: Graco SlimFit 3 in 1 Convertible Car Seat | Infant to Toddler Car Seat, Saves Space in your Back Seat, Annabelle
product_meta.description: Color:AnnabelleThe Graco Slim Fit All-in-One convertible car seat saves space in your backseat, while giving your child plenty of room to grow. The unique, rotating cup holders simply rotate away, making the seat 10% slimmer to save precious back seat space. It's a rear-facing (5-40 lb) and forward-facing (20-65 lb) car seat, as well as a belt-positioning booster (30-100 lb). The Simply Safe Adjust Harness System means you can easily adjust the harness and headrest together, to accommodate your growing child with ease. With 4-recline positions, you can keep your child comfortable, while the In Right Latch system makes installation easy with a one-second attachment. The seat is side-impact tested, and Safe Seat Engineered, giving you peace of mind. With all these great benefits, in a sleek space saving design, the Slim Fit is the perfect car seat. Note-Latch consists of lower anchors and top tether anchors, which are built-in to your vehicle, and connecting hooks that are built-in to your car seat. Lower anchors are used instead of the vehicle seat belt to secure the child seat to the vehicle. Top tethers are used in addition to the lower anchors or the vehicle’s seat belt to secure a forward-facing car seat to the vehicle. Do not use the lower anchors of the child restraint anchorage system Latch system to attach this child restraint when restraining a child weighing more than 45 pounds with the internal harnesses of the child restraint. Harness straps may be spot cleaned. After reaching the maximum forward-facing weight and height, they also recommend that children 4 feet 9 inches tall or under should ride in a belt-positioning booster seat.
feature_bullets: All in One seat grows with Your child from 5 100 pounds, rear to forward facing and becomes a belt positioning booster; save space in Your back seat with Unique rotating cup Holders
Simply Safe Adjust Harness System adjusts the height of Your harness and headrest; Integrated harness storage compartment Holds unused harness straps while seat is a belt positioning booster

Engineered & crash tested to meet or exceed US Standard FMVSS 213; the Slim Fit car seat has been side impact tested for occupant retention solely with the built in 5 Point harness system; Features EPS foam

In Right Latch system for an Easy, one second Latch attachment; 4 position recline helps keep Your growing child comfy, in rear and forward facing modes; Car seat depth is 16.25 inch; Car seat height is 25.5 inch; Car Seat Width Inside is 19.75 inch
Plush Supports keep Your child comfortable and are removable; washable seat cover is Easy to access without removing the harness; Buckle may be cleaned with a damp cloth

Graco Protect Plus Engineered: a combination of the most rigorous crash tests that helps protect Your child in frontal, side, rear & rollover crashes; additional testing based on the New Car Assessment Program and for extreme car interior Temperatures
Graco Supports the American Academy of Pediatrics and National Highway Traffic Safety Administration's Car Seat Guidelines.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.9 out of 5 stars5,822 ratings4.9 out of 5 stars
